Hear about our immediate priorities, as well as what we have in store for the long game. Most importantly, we want to hear from you about what is happening in your community.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

We had such a great conversation with members from all over Virginia during our inaugural Member Forums in 2017 that we just had to keep it going! Here come the 2nd Annual ACLU of Virginia Member Forums!

We are hosting member forums this year in five locations that represent an even broader tour of the state than we undertook our first time out. At these events, we will share our vision and try to empower everyone to engage locally in an effort to defend civil liberties and advance civil rights. Learn what you can do to help advance our goal of securing freedom and equality for all in the Commonwealth.

But we also want to hear from you. We want to know about civil rights issues you face wherever you live and no matter who you are. Whether your problems are related to discrimination, voting rights, the criminal justice system, access to abortion, overly aggressive law enforcement, censorship and denial of free speech rights, school-to-prison pipeline, government that is closed to public scrutiny, privacy and surveillance, or something else, we want to hear about it.

Here are the dates and locations we have scheduled so far:

Wytheville
Wednesday, May 23, 7-8:30 p.m.
Wytheville Community College
Grayson Hall, Snyder Auditorium

Danville
Thursday, May 24, 7-8:30 p.m.
Glenwood Community Center

Newport News
Wednesday, June 6, 7-8:30 p.m.
Christopher Newport University
Freeman Center, Meeting Room 202

Stay tuned for news about additional member forums to be held in Richmond and the Shenandoah Valley this fall!

Register now for a member forum in your area!

Sincerely,

ACLU of Virginia

Note: ACLU of Virginia member forums are not affiliated with, endorsed, or sponsored by the venues, organizations or institutions at which these events are being held.
